job_description:
DevOps Engineer - 5+ Years Experience

Notice Period: Immediate to 15 Days

Qualification: BTech/BE/Masters is mandatory

Key Responsibilities: - Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI) for containerized microservices across shore and vessel environments. - Architect and manage cloud-agnostic deployments across AWS, Azure, and on-premise (vessel) environments using Kubernetes and Docker. - Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform & Ansible. - Set up automated health checks, monitoring, and logging systems for real-time operational visibility (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Datadog, etc.). - Support and manage PostgreSQL Write-Ahead Logging (WAL) replication and data sync agents between offline (vessel) and online (shore/cloud) systems. - Ensure high availability through multi-zone or hot standby configurations in the cloud. - Handle RBAC, PBAC, OAuth2/OIDC, and Zero Trust implementation via API Gateway, WAF, and Identity Server. - Coordinate with backend/frontend engineers and QA teams for release planning and post-deployment support.

Must-Have Skills: - Strong experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and containerized microservices. - Hands-on with Terraform, Helm, Ansible and IaC frameworks. - Deep understanding of GitOps, release pipelines, and feature toggling. - Experience working with PostgreSQL including WAL and logical replication. - Familiarity with network protocols, CDN, firewalls, and reverse proxies. - Cloud-native architecture experience (AWS, Azure, GCP) and hybrid deployments. - Strong scripting (Python, Bash, PowerShell) and automation skills.

Good-to-Have: - Experience with IoT edge computing (MODBUS, MQTT, NMEA protocols) onboard vessels. - Exposure to zero-downtime deployments, blue/green, or canary releases. - Understanding of maritime compliance standards: IMO, SOLAS, GDPR, etc.

Soft Skills: - Strong leadership and mentoring abilities. - Excellent communication and documentation skills. - Decision-maker under pressure, especially during outages or sync failures. - Collaborative mindset with cross-functional teams.

job_description:
SOC Lead / Senior Consultant Specialist

Location: Kochi

Role Overview: The SOC Lead serves as a senior member of the Monitoring and Threat Detection function. This role focuses on high-quality incident triage, technical escalation management, continuous improvement of detection capabilities, and leading incident analysis across enterprise-wide environments. The SOC Lead mentors L1/L2 analysts, ensures SLA compliance, and drives process innovation within the SOC.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead deeper security investigations (L2/L3) and advanced triage of escalated alerts across SIEM, EDR, and email security platforms.
  • Collaborate with Threat Detection, Incident Response, and Threat Hunting teams to validate and escalate potential threats.
  • Oversee quality assurance of security tickets and ensure accurate root cause and kill chain identification.
  • Manage the design and optimization of detection rules, threat correlation logic, and playbooks within SIEM/SOAR tools.
  • Provide subject matter expertise in high-severity incident response and containment, ensuring coordinated communication with clients and internal stakeholders.
  • Conduct and support Purple Team simulations and threat validation exercises to assess detection efficacy.
  • Mentor and guide SOC analysts, fostering technical growth and enforcing operational discipline.
  • Coordinate with enterprise teams on email and cloud security incidents, leading Proofpoint and Microsoft 365 Defender investigations.
  • Define and maintain documentation including incident response procedures, triage guides, and detection playbooks.
  • Contribute to automation initiatives to reduce repetitive manual work and improve response efficiency.

Additional Responsibilities:

  • Lead SIEM architecture and design, ensuring scalable log ingestion, parsing, normalization, and enrichment across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Oversee SIEM administration, including connector management, health monitoring, log source onboarding, and retention optimization.
  • Define and enforce triage standards for SIEM alerts, ensuring consistent severity classification, enrichment, and correlation logic.
  • Evaluate and enhance SIEM use case lifecycle management—from requirements gathering to rule tuning, false-positive reduction, and KPI reporting.
  • Drive continuous improvement of SIEM detection coverage, aligning with threat models, MITRE ATT&CK techniques, and emerging adversary behaviors.

Core Skills and Experience:

  • Over 10 years of cybersecurity operations experience, with at least 4-5 years in SOC L2/L3 or senior incident response roles.
  • Hands-on expertise with multiple SIEM platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure Wazuh, Splunk, Log360, Elastic).
  • Proficient with leading EDR tools such as CrowdStrike, Microsoft Defender, SentinelOne, Fortinet.
  • Strong working knowledge of Email Security (TAP, DLP, Threat Response, SPF/DKIM/DMARC) tools such as FortiMail, Microsoft Purview, Proofpoint.
  • Expertise in attack vectors, MITRE ATT&CK mapping, threat analysis, and incident containment strategies.
  • Solid understanding of enterprise infrastructure — networks, firewalls, endpoint platforms, OS (Windows/Linux), and web applications.
  • Excellent knowledge of cloud security operations across Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud.
  • Awareness of major security frameworks: ISO 27001, NIST, CIS, OWASP, and PCI DSS.
  • Functional knowledge of SOAR automation and orchestration workflows.

Leadership and Delivery:

  • Lead service operations ensuring incident SLAs are consistently met.
  • Conduct regular performance reviews and provide knowledge-sharing sessions to elevate SOC maturity.
  • Liaise with customers to discuss incident outcomes, mitigations, and improvement recommendations.
  • Manage process documentation and enforce consistent global SOC methodologies.

Desired Certifications:

  • CEH, GCIA, GCIH, CISSP, or equivalent cybersecurity certifications.
  • Vendor-specific credentials (Microsoft, Proofpoint, or SIEM/EDR certifications) preferred.

Additional Attributes:

  • Strong analytical, investigative, and documentation skills.
  • Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
  • Self-driven with ability to manage multiple escalations under pressure.
  • Flexible to work in a 24x7 rotational environment if required.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at merin.cb@arttechgroup.com
summary: Senior SOC Lead responsible for incident triage, threat detection, and team mentorship. Drives process innovation and ensures SLA compliance in security operations.

job_description:

About Techversant:

Techversant is a global technology services and solutions company with over 17 years of experience providing high-quality end-to-end IT solutions and services to clients worldwide. We offer expertise and consultation in various technology domains including ColdFusion, Python, Java, .NET, Node JS, Ruby on Rails, Golang, PHP, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, iOS, Android, Flutter, React Native, Angular, React Vue, and more, catering to diverse industry verticals globally.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Full Stack ColdFusion Lead with 8+ years of experience, coupled with proven technical leadership and mentorship capabilities. The core function requires mastery of CFML, OOP, and robust MVC frameworks (like ColdBox, FW/1), alongside advanced database tuning and RESTful API development. Success depends on exceptional diagnostic skills and architectural oversight to ensure high-performance enterprise applications. Experience with migration (Adobe to Lucee), React.js knowledge, and CI/CD practices is considered desirable.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the architecture, design, and development of enterprise-grade, high-performance web applications using ColdFusion and Lucee, integrating modern frontend technologies like React.js.
  • Drive initiatives to migrate legacy Adobe ColdFusion applications to the Lucee platform, ensuring seamless transition, compatibility, and performance optimization.
  • Guide, mentor, and coach a team of developers, performing rigorous code reviews and enforcing best practices and coding standards.
  • Collaborate closely with business analysts and stakeholders to gather complex requirements, define technical specifications, and manage project lifecycles.
  • Oversee performance optimization for existing applications and new feature development, focusing on scalability, security, and reliability.
  • Develop and integrate backend systems with frontend interfaces and third-party services using RESTful APIs, SOAP web services, JSON, and XML data formats.

Preferred Skills:

  • 8+ years of extensive experience in Full Stack ColdFusion development, including proven technical leadership or team management roles.
  • Primary Skills: Deep expertise in CFML, CFCs, SQL, and related web technologies (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery).
  • Advanced experience in architecting, designing, and leading the development of highly scalable and complex enterprise-level applications, applying Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles and robust MVC frameworks (e.g., ColdBox, FW/1).
  • Mastery in hands-on development, optimization, and maintenance of critical web applications using CFML. This includes deep proficiency in database performance tuning, complex SQL query optimization, and schema design for relational databases like Oracle, SQL Server, or MySQL.
  • Extensive experience in designing, developing, and consuming complex RESTful APIs and SOAP web services using JSON and XML data formats.
  • Proven experience in migrating legacy ColdFusion applications to modern platforms, including migration experience from Adobe ColdFusion to Lucee server environments.
  • Strong capability in modern frontend development using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, and Ajax. Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks, specifically React.js, is required.
  • Expert knowledge of code version control tools like Git or SVN. Experience in driving and implementing modern development practices, including CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and DevOps principles.
  • Exceptional diagnostic and troubleshooting skills for highly complex, mission-critical issues in production environments. Eagerness to debug and ensure maximum application uptime and performance.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. Ability to gather complex requirements, collaborate with cross-functional teams, mentor junior developers, and translate sophisticated business needs into robust technical deliverables.

Nice to Have:

job_description:
Senior Database Engineer (Microsoft SQL Server)

Company: DeviceDriven India (P) Ltd Location: Padmanabha, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: http://www.devicedriven.com Closing Date: 22, Dec 2025 Job Published: 22, Nov 2025 Contact Email: jobs@devicedriven.com

About the Opportunity

You will work on a digital transformation program modernizing a global-scale transaction and engagement platform. The platform handles millions of real-time, high-volume operations across multiple regions and partner ecosystems. We are looking for a Senior SQL Server Database Engineer who can take ownership of database performance, reliability, architecture, and operational excellence for a mission-critical, highly transactional platform running on Microsoft SQL Server in a cloud environment.

Role Overview

In this senior role, you will be the primary SQL Server expert responsible for: - Designing and optimizing database schemas - Ensuring high availability and operational resilience - Performance tuning for large-scale transactional workloads - Managing upgrades, patching, and maintenance - Supporting engineering teams during feature development and releases - Ensuring data integrity, recoverability, and system reliability

You will work closely with application engineering, DevOps, and architecture teams to ensure the platform’s data layer is fast, scalable, secure, and predictable.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Database Architecture & Design

    • Design, model, and optimize SQL Server schemas for high-throughput transactional systems
    • Define best practices for indexing, normalization, partitioning, and query design
    • Review and guide schema evolution and data modeling decisions with engineering teams

  2. Performance, Tuning & Optimization

    • Diagnose and resolve performance bottlenecks: blocking, deadlocks, concurrency issues, slow queries
    • Optimize execution plans, indexing strategies, statistics, and resource configuration
    • Conduct regular health assessments and create remediation plans

  3. High Availability & Disaster Recovery

    • Design, configure, and maintain AlwaysOn Availability Groups, clustering, log shipping, replication, and other HA/DR mechanisms
    • Own backup, restore, and failover processes, including regular testing and validation
    • Ensure data consistency, integrity, and uptime across multiple environments

  4. Operations, Monitoring & Reliability

    • Monitor SQL Server performance using DMVs, PerfMon, Extended Events, Query Store, and profiling tools
    • Establish alerting and automated monitoring for query performance, storage, replication, and job failures
    • Own routine maintenance: index management, statistics updates, patching, upgrades

  5. Cloud & Platform Integration (GCP Environment)

    • Manage SQL Server deployments and operations within a GCP-hosted environment
    • Collaborate with DevOps and infrastructure teams on provisioning, scaling, security, and observability
    • Integrate DB operations into CI/CD and release processes (migrations, pre-flight checks, rollback strategies)

  6. Security, Access & Compliance Alignment

    • Implement secure authentication, authorization, role management, and least-privilege access
    • Maintain auditing, logging, and compliance-aligned configuration for sensitive financial data
    • Ensure encryption, retention, and governance policies are enforced

  7. Data Integration, Reporting & Migration

    • Support ETL, reporting, and analytical workloads via SSIS/SSRS or equivalent tools
    • Lead structured data migration efforts between environments or SQL Server versions
    • Work with engineering teams to expose reliable, efficient data interfaces

Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Expertise * 7–12+ years in Database Engineering / SQL Server Administration * Strong hands-on expertise in: * Microsoft SQL Server (advanced configuration, tuning, internals) * AlwaysOn, clustering, replication, log shipping * Performance tuning and query optimization * Backup/restore, DR planning, failover testing * SQL Profiler, Extended Events, DMVs, Query Store * Experience supporting high-volume OLTP systems * Experience operating SQL Server in cloud environments (GCP preferred; AWS/Azure acceptable) * Strong understanding of concurrency, locking, transactions, isolation levels, and recovery models

Nice-to-Have * SSIS / SSRS / ETL experience * Experience with Looker, data warehousing, or analytical pipelines * Experience with container-based or microservices ecosystems * Fintech or regulated environment experience * Exposure to automation via scripting (PowerShell, Python, Bash)

Soft Skills * Strong ownership and accountability * Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities * Clear communication and ability to work with cross-functional teams * Calm under pressure and experienced with production incident handling * Strong documentation discipline

Why Join DeviceDriven

  • Work on a global, high-volume platform with real engineering complexity
  • Take full ownership of the database layer in a modern cloud environment
  • Collaborate with senior architects, backend, DevOps, and AI engineering teams
  • Opportunity to evolve into Database Architect or Platform Data Engineering Lead roles
  • Culture of technical excellence, autonomy, and innovation

How to Apply

  • Send your resume, GitHub/LinkedIn profile, and a short introduction to: jobs@devicedriven.com
summary: Seeking a Senior SQL Server Database Engineer for a global platform modernization. Responsibilities include database performance, reliability, architecture, and operational excellence in a cloud environment.

job_description:
Solution Architect (Optimizely)

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India , 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com Job Published: 21, Nov 2025 Closing Date: 28, Nov 2025

Brief Description

We are looking for candidates with 12+ years of experience for this role.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect to lead the design and implementation of a large-scale migration from SAP B2B to Optimizely Commerce Cloud. This role will serve as the technical leader, responsible for defining a scalable, secure, and future-ready architecture. The ideal candidate has deep expertise in enterprise commerce systems, cloud architecture, and system integrations. You will guide development teams, ensure best practices in solution design, and ultimately take full ownership of the architecture and development transition from the vendor.

Responsibilities:

Architecture & Design - Define the end-to-end migration architecture from SAP B2B to Optimizely, including CMS, Commerce, and PIM integration. - Design scalable, secure, and high-performance frameworks aligned with business goals. - Establish data migration strategies for products, pricing, and customer hierarchies. - Ensure API integration between SAP, Optimizely, and other enterprise systems.

Technical Leadership - Lead and mentor development teams on best practices and coding standards. - Collaborate with Optimizely consultants and internal teams to validate feasibility and technical approach. - Drive DevOps strategy for CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and cloud deployment.

Project Ownership - Act as the technical owner of the migration project, taking over from vendor after initial phases. - Ensure alignment with enterprise security and compliance standards. - Provide technical guidance during feasibility analysis and pilot module migration.

Collaboration & Communication - Work closely with Business Analysts to translate requirements into technical solutions. - Communicate architecture decisions to stakeholders and leadership in business-friendly terms. - Support QA teams with test strategy for performance, integration, and security.

Preferred Skills:

Primary Skills:

Technical Expertise - SAP B2B Architecture: Deep understanding of SAP Commerce Cloud, Back Office, and integration patterns. - B2B Platform: Hands-on experience with CMS and Commerce Cloud platforms, specifically Optimizely. - Optimizely PIM & Spire: Strong knowledge of Optimizely Product Information Management (PIM) and Spire framework for modern commerce experiences. - .NET Development: Proficient in .NET Core and ASP.NET, essential for Optimizely development. - Cloud Architecture: Strong knowledge of Azure PaaS, commonly used for hosting Optimizely solutions. - Azure Active Directory: Experience with identity and access management using Azure AD. - API Design & Integration: Skilled in RESTful services, SAP APIs, and Optimizely endpoints. - Frontend Development: Strong React expertise with CMS integration experience.

Architectural Leadership - Modern Architecture Concepts: Experience with monolithic and microservices-based systems. - Solution Architecture Design: Ability to design scalable, secure, and maintainable frameworks. - System Integration: Expertise in bridging SAP and Optimizely platforms, including middleware and data flow strategies. - Performance & Scalability: Planning for optimized performance and future growth. - Security & Compliance: Knowledge of enterprise-grade security, data protection, and regulatory standards.

Project Ownership - End-to-End Leadership: Proven ability to lead projects from blueprint to execution. - Vendor Transition: Skilled in taking over architecture and development from external consultants. - Stakeholder Communication: Capable of translating technical decisions into business value for diverse audiences.

Secondary Skills:

Technical Enhancements - GraphQL & Headless CMS Architecture: Beneficial for building modern, flexible commerce experiences. - DevOps & CI/CD Pipelines: Experience with tools like Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions for automated deployments. - Containerization: Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes for scalable and efficient deployments.

Soft Skills:

Team Mentoring & Coaching: Experienced in guiding developers through complex migration phases and technical transitions. Agile Methodology: Skilled in managing sprints, backlogs, and iterative delivery cycles to ensure timely and quality outcomes. Analytical Thinking & Problem-Solving: Strong capability in feasibility analysis, module mapping, and resolving architectural challenges. Continuous Learning Mindset: Proactively stays updated with evolving trends in SAP BTP, Optimizely, and cloud technologies.
summary: Seeking an experienced Solution Architect for SAP B2B to Optimizely migration. Lead design, implementation, and technical ownership of a scalable, secure commerce cloud architecture.

job_description:
Sr. Preproduction Artist

Company: Prayan Animation Studio (P) Ltd. Location: E-12, Tejaswini-1, Technopark, Trivandrum, Kerala, India, 695 581 Website: http://www.prayananimation.com Contact Email: jobs@prayananimation.com

Closing Date: 30, Nov 2025 Job Published: 21, Nov 2025

Job Overview:

The Sr. Preproduction Artist will be responsible for visualizing scripts and transforming concepts into clear, engaging storyboards that support the overall vision of our 2D animation projects. The ideal candidate will have exceptional drawing skills, a deep understanding of animation principles, and at least 10+ years of professional experience in the animation industry.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create detailed storyboards that clearly convey narrative, emotion, timing, and camera language.
  • Develop polished animatics with accurate timing, pacing, and continuity for production.
  • Design original characters, including model sheets, poses, expressions, and turnarounds.
  • Visualize scripts and concepts creatively while maintaining consistency with the project’s style and director’s vision.
  • Collaborate closely with directors, writers, and the production team to refine storytelling.
  • Ensure all pre-production deliverables meet quality standards and project timelines.
  • Participate in creative discussions, offer visual solutions, and adapt to feedback quickly.
  • Prepare production-ready files and maintain organized documentation.

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of experience in storyboarding, animatic, and character design for animation.
  • Strong drawing skills with an excellent understanding of anatomy, proportion, perspectives, and acting.
  • Proficiency in storyboard and animatic tools such as Adobe Animate, Photoshop, or equivalent.
  • Solid grasp of cinematic storytelling, shot composition, timing, and staging.
  • Ability to design appealing and original characters in varied styles.
  • Strong sense of storytelling, rhythm, and visual clarity.
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines and handle multiple projects.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Job Details:

  • Job Type: Full-time
  • Schedule: Day shift
  • Commute/Relocation: Must be able to reliably commute or plan to relocate to Trivandrum, Kerala before starting work.
  • Expected Start Date: Immediate Joining

How to Apply:

To apply, please submit your resume and a link of your online portfolio highlighting your best work to jobs@prayananimation.com. Please use the email subject: "Resume – Sr Pre Production Artist".
summary: Seeking a Sr. Preproduction Artist with 10+ years of experience for 2D animation. Responsibilities include storyboarding, character design, and collaborating with the production team.
